Detailed Description

Apply geometric transformations to frames: Mirroring, resizing, or affine transformations such as rotation, scale, or shear.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum cvl_interpolation_type_t
 

The interpolation technique.

Enumerator:
CVL_INTERPOLATION_NONE  No interpolation (nearest neighbor).
CVL_INTERPOLATION_BILINEAR  Bilinear interpolation.

Function Documentation

Parameters:
frame The frame.
Returns:
The flipped frame.
Flips a frame left/right.

Parameters:
frame The frame.
Returns:
The flopped frame.
Flops a frame top/bottom.

cvl_frame_t* cvl_frame_resize (  const cvl_frame_t *  frame,
cvl_color_t  color,
int  new_width,
int  new_height,
int  new_x_offset,
int  new_y_offset
) 
 

Parameters:
frame The frame.
color The color that resulting holes will be filled with.
new_width The new width of the frame.
new_height The new height of the frame.
new_x_offset The x position of the original frame contents in the resized frame.
new_y_offset The y position of the original frame contents in the resized frame.
Returns:
The resized frame.
Resizes a frame.

int  x,
int  y,
int  w,
int  h
) 
 

Parameters:
frame The frame.
x The x coordinate of the rectangle.
y The y coordinate of the rectangle.
w The width of the rectangle.
h The height of the rectangle.
Returns:
A frame containing only the specified rectangle.
Cuts a rectangle out of a frame.

cvl_interpolation_type_t  interpolation_type,
int  new_width,
int  new_height
) 
 

Parameters:
frame The frame.
interpolation_type The interpolation type to use.
new_width The new width.
new_height The new height.
Returns:
The scaled frame.
Scales a frame.

cvl_frame_t* cvl_frame_rotate (  const cvl_frame_t *  frame,
cvl_interpolation_type_t  interpolation_type,
cvl_color_t  color,
double  angle
) 
 

Parameters:
frame The frame.
interpolation_type The interpolation type to use.
color The color to fill resulting holes with.
angle The rotation angle in radians.
Returns:
The rotated frame.
Rotates a frame. Rotation is done counterclockwise. The rotated frame will be big enough to hold all information from the source, therefore it will in general be bigger than the original frame. Simple rotations (0, 90, 180, 270) are implemented as fast special cases.

cvl_frame_t* cvl_frame_shear (  const cvl_frame_t *  frame,
cvl_interpolation_type_t  interpolation_type,
cvl_color_t  color,
double  shear_angle_x,
double  shear_angle_y
) 
 

Parameters:
frame The frame.
interpolation_type The interpolation type to use.
color The color to fill resulting holes with.
shear_angle_x The shear angle in horizontal direction, in radians.
shear_angle_y The shear angle in vertical direction, in radians.
Returns:
The sheared frame.
Shears a frame. The angles should be from (-PI/2, PI/2). Negative angles shear clockwise. The angles should not be to close to -PI/2 or PI/2, or the resulting frame will be unreasonable wide.

cvl_frame_t* cvl_frame_affine (  const cvl_frame_t *  frame,
cvl_interpolation_type_t  interpolation_type,
cvl_color_t  color,
const double *  matrix
) 
 

Parameters:
frame The frame.
interpolation_type The interpolation type to use.
color The color to fill resulting holes with.
matrix A 2x2 transformation matrix as an array of 4 doubles.
Returns:
The transformed frame.
Applies an affine transformation on a frame.
